# b00tl3gRSA2

## Descripcion Reto
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566`.

## Pistas
1. What is e generally?

## Solución
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/hacking/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566
c: 
n: 
e: 

┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/hacking/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ python3    
```python3
```
Python 3.11.2 (main, Mar 13 2023, 12:18:29) [GCC 12.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> 
>>> c = 
>>> n = 
>>> d = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> 
>>> m = pow(c, d, n)
>>> m

>>> 
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> 
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b"\x93\x99\x9b\x87\x17\xd4\xce\x015EX\x90\xb2\x8cA\xb4~\xe7:\xc2\xeeO\xc5\xeba\xcfx\xd8\xb9]Ul\xfb!\x06\x05\x8e\x98\xfa\xf6${\xf5=\xe8\xec\xa7\xdcRs\x0c\x8f\x13\x15F]\xb9'\xa3\x17\xf4\x01W\xb25\x85\x9a\x89\xbb\xb2\x02\x0c\xd3\xd9\x1f\xd6\x1d\x07\xc9\xb9[\xfey!\xb5 \xc6\xdb\xe5Hb1@\xb3\x85=\xe1\xde\x0e \x80)JL\xef\xfa\xcb\xf8&\xc3\xe9\xe1\n~\x1b\x7f\x82\xd0,\xb7\rph\xf76L1\xec"
>>> 
>>> m = pow(c, e, n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653321164402927482237
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}'
>>> 


```

## Bandera
* picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}
